'A while ago, a website talked about the dangers of telling everyone where you are online. The website said that when you say, "Hey, I’m here," you are also telling everyone, even people you don’t know. This made people think that sharing everything online might not be good. The internet lets us share our lives with many people. We can become famous or rich! So, we share our stories and photos online. But sometimes, we find out that it can be dangerous and confusing. 
In the early days of the internet, some people tried sharing their lives online. They lost jobs, made and lost friends, and dealt with being famous. These people were the first bloggers. They learned lessons that we can learn from too. 
In 1994, a student named Justin Hall started sharing his life online. He wrote about everything and shared photos. People liked reading about his life. But one day, he had to stop because it caused problems in his personal life. He learned that sharing too much online can make people not trust you.
In 2002, Heather Armstrong wrote about her job on her blog. Someone at her job saw it and told her bosses. She lost her job. This shows that what we say online can affect our real lives. But later, Heather started writing about her family and became very popular. She learned to share carefully online.
The internet lets us say anything, but we should be careful about what we share.'

'Some scientists talked about a movie called What the Bleep Do We Know? This movie mixed real facts and stories to show that there is a lot about our universe we do not understand. Scientists agree that we do not know everything about the universe. But some scientists did not like the movie. They said it was bad and even dangerous. 
At first, the movie seemed okay. It showed scientists saying that new discoveries make the universe seem stranger than we thought. But then, the movie talked about water changing because of thoughts. It showed pictures of ice crystals looking nice after happy thoughts and not nice after bad thoughts. Some people liked this idea, but many scientists did not believe it. They wanted real proof, not just pictures.
The movie's ideas were not strange enough. Scientists have found that the universe is made of unknown matter and is pushed by something called 'dark energy'. This is real and comes from many years of research. Scientists also found that our brains take half a second to understand what we see. They also found where modern humans came from and how they spread around the world.
Science is not finished. We still have a lot to learn. Some scientists are trying to find a Theory of Everything to explain all forces and particles in the universe. Many people think the universe is amazing.'

I like writing stories. Writing long stories, called novels, is hard. Writing short stories is fun. Writing a novel is like making a big forest. Writing a short story is like making a small garden. Both are important to me. 
When I write a novel, I do not write short stories. When I write short stories, I do not write a novel. I started writing short stories in 1984. It was new for me, but I enjoyed it. People liked my short stories too. One of my first short stories was 'Breaking Waves'. It was in my first book of short stories.
Short stories are quick to write. I can finish one in about a week. Novels take a long time, maybe one or two years. Short stories can come from small ideas, like a word or a picture. It is like playing jazz music. If a short story is not good, it is okay. Not all stories are perfect. Even famous writers like F. Scott Fitzgerald and Raymond Carver did not write perfect stories every time.
I learn from writing short stories. They help me write better novels. Short stories are like small steps I take. I remember each one and how I felt. They show my feelings, and I like sharing them with readers.

Science is about learning and understanding the world. It helps us in many ways, like curing diseases. Science tries to understand small things like ants and big things like the universe. Sometimes, science changes what we know. New ideas can be hard to accept at first, but they can become important later. Scientists often disagree, but this helps science grow. 
Science is always changing. One scientist might find a new idea that changes what we thought before. Sometimes, these changes are big and make us think differently about the world. For example, a long time ago, people thought the universe was like a big clock. Later, scientists like Isaac Newton and Albert Einstein found new ideas that changed this view.
Science has given us many new things, like X-rays and the idea of the Big Bang. Some people think we might soon understand everything about the universe. Science is important because it helps us control and change the world. But we must be careful because changes can affect nature. Everyone should know about science because it affects our future and our children's future.

'Around 2015, big book companies saw that ebook sales stopped growing or went down. This made people wonder if ebooks would be popular for a long time. Some people thought ebooks were too exciting and spent too much money on them. They forgot how nice paper books are. People still ask if ebooks will replace paper books. This question makes us think a lot. Why do we think ebooks and paper books are fighting? This is because we feel excited and scared about new things. In the past, people thought new things would end old things. When TV came, people thought radio would end, but radio found new ways to be useful. People listened to it in cars and at work. Long ago, people thought audiobooks would replace paper books. Many times, people thought new things like movies, radio, and smartphones would end paper books. Some people worried this would be bad for culture. Others thought ebooks were much better. We often think about the end of books when new technology comes. We love things like books and TVs because they are part of our lives. When new things come, we have to change how we feel about old things. This makes us miss the old things. That's why people like old products. When printing started in the 15th century, people wanted old handwritten books. When movies got sound, people missed silent movies. The same happened with photos and music records. Ebooks made people like old paper books more. This shows that paper books might not go away. We like stories about change and endings because they help us understand new things. These stories show our excitement for the future and our fear of losing what we know.'

'Every weekday morning for a year and a half, I woke up at 5:30. I brushed my teeth, made coffee, and wrote about how famous people from the past 400 years did their best work. I wanted to know how they found time to be creative and productive. I wrote about their daily lives, like when they slept, ate, and worked. I wanted to show their habits and routines. 
The book is called Daily Rituals. It is about people's routines. A routine is something you do every day without thinking much. A good routine can help you use your time well. The psychologist William James said good habits can help us do more interesting things. But he was not good at keeping a schedule himself.
I got the idea for this book one Sunday. I was at work, trying to write a story. But I was wasting time, cleaning my desk and making coffee. I am a morning person, so I work best in the morning. That day, I looked online for other writers' schedules. I found many stories and thought someone should collect them. So, I started a blog called Daily Routines and then wrote this book.
For the book, I found more stories and did more research. I let the people speak for themselves with quotes from letters and interviews. I also used other sources to describe their routines. I thank the many writers and researchers whose work helped me. You can find all my sources in the Notes section for more reading.'

Howard loved fossils. When he was six, his family could not go to Spain for a holiday because of money problems. Instead, they went to the English coast. There, Howard found a fossil called an ammonite on the beach. This made him want to study old rocks and fossils. 
At university, Howard decided he wanted to study very old fossils, not dinosaurs. He liked studying tiny creatures in rocks. After finishing his studies, he worried about finding a job. He wanted to work at a good place. 
Howard applied for a job at Tavistock College in London. On the day of his interview, the main professor had an accident and could not come. Another professor, who did not like the first professor, helped Howard get the job. Howard was happy to get the job, even though he knew it was because of the professor's dislike for the other candidate.
One day, someone stole Howard's briefcase with his lecture notes. He was upset but went for coffee. There, he met a visitor from the Natural History Museum in Nairobi. The visitor told him about new fossils at the museum. Howard was excited and changed his plans. He decided to visit the museum in Nairobi to study the fossils. This was a big chance for his career.

Charles Spence likes to eat many different foods. He even has ice cream made from bee larvae at home. It tastes a bit like nuts and flowers. Charles is a professor at Oxford University in the UK. He studies how our senses work together to make us taste food. His work helps big food companies and famous restaurants decide what to put on their menus.
Charles and his team look at many things that change how we taste food. This includes who we eat with, how food looks on the plate, and even the sounds we hear while eating. For example, people eat more when they are with others. Also, music can change how sweet or bitter food tastes.
Charles works in a simple lab with old equipment. He gets money from big food companies to do his research. This helps him work with chefs who cannot pay for research. He helps companies reduce salt and sugar in food without people noticing.
Charles also works with a famous chef named Heston Blumenthal. Together, they created a dish called 'Sound of the Sea' that uses sound to change how food tastes. Charles found that high-pitched music makes food taste sweeter, and low-pitched music makes it taste bitter.
Charles's work is used by many food companies. For example, an airline will use music to make food taste better for passengers. At home, Charles likes to have fun with food. He has dinner parties with special lights and sounds to see how they change the taste of food.

'Our brains are very busy today. We get a lot of information, some true and some not. We have to decide what is important and what is not. We also do many things ourselves now. Before, travel agents helped us with flights, and salespeople helped us in shops. Now, we do these things alone. We try to do many things at once, like work, family, hobbies, and watching TV. Our smartphones help us do this. But doing many things at once is not good. Earl Miller, a brain expert, says our brains cannot do many things at the same time. We switch from one thing to another very fast, and this is not good for our brains. We think we do a lot, but we are less efficient. Doing many things at once makes us stressed and confused. Our brains like new things, so we get distracted easily. Just having the chance to do many things at once is bad for our brains. Glenn Wilson, a psychology expert, says trying to focus when we have unread emails makes us less smart. Russ Poldrack, another brain expert, says learning while doing other things sends information to the wrong part of the brain. If students do homework and watch TV, the homework information goes to the wrong place in the brain. Making decisions is also hard for our brains. Many small decisions can make us tired and lead to bad big decisions. Email is a big problem. We get too many emails and feel we must answer them, but it is hard to do this and do other things too.'

In a zoo in Sweden, a chimpanzee named Santino broke concrete at night to throw at people during the day. Was he being mean? In the US, female bats help other bats give birth. Are they being kind? 
Fifty years ago, people did not think much about these questions. Scientists watched what animals did and wrote it down. They did not think animals had feelings or thoughts. But now, some scientists are starting to think animals might have feelings. 
Books like "Wild Justice" and "Do Fish Feel Pain?" talk about animal feelings. This has started a big question: do animals have thoughts like people? 
In one study, cows had to open a gate to get food. Cows that opened the gate themselves were happier than those that needed help. This makes people think about how we treat animals like cows. 
Some people, like Dr. Jonathan Balcombe, say we should stop eating meat because animals have feelings. Others, like Professor Aubrey Manning, say we should think more about how animals think. But Professor Euan MacPhail says we should not think animals are like people. 
This is a hard question because it is not just about science. It is also about what we believe. 
Dr. Balcombe did a study with birds called starlings. Some birds lived in nice cages, and some in bad cages. Birds in nice cages ate bad food when they had to, but birds in bad cages did not. Dr. Balcombe thinks this shows birds can feel sad. 
Dr. Balcombe believes we will one day think about animals like we think about people. Professor Manning agrees that we are changing how we think about animals. 
This is a big topic, and people have different opinions.

'Thinking carefully is a way to understand what we read or hear better. Adrian West, a teacher, says that arguing can help find the truth. Technology helps us keep and use information, but it might also change how we solve problems. We see a lot of ideas and opinions, which can make it hard to think clearly. More information does not always mean better knowledge. Reading books is going down, and this might make thinking less strong. Patricia Greenfield, a teacher, says that watching videos and doing many things at once can make thinking weaker. We do not know exactly how technology changes thinking. Computers and games can be good or bad for thinking. Reading helps us think and imagine, but videos do not. Some videos help with quick thinking, but they do not give time to think deeply. Many young people do not use their full abilities. Video games can be fun and help learn. Games like Sim City teach decision-making and thinking skills. In the digital age, we need to understand how technology changes thinking.'

Matthew Crawford works as a motorcycle mechanic. Before this, he worked in an office but did not like it. He wrote a book about how working with your hands is good. His new book talks about how to live in today's world. He got the idea when he saw ads on a credit card machine while shopping. He thinks these ads make it hard for us to focus on what we want. We are often distracted and do not talk to people around us. We use phones and games a lot, which can take over our attention. 
Crawford is not the only one worried. Many people feel distracted by emails and phones. When a phone is on the table, it can make us lose focus. This problem is not new; people worried about it even when the telegraph was invented. Technology gives us many choices, and this can be hard for us. We often text instead of talking to friends. 
Crawford says we need to control noise and distractions in public places. He also thinks doing skilled activities, like cooking or playing sports, helps us connect with the real world. These activities need focus and help us work with others. They show us that real experiences are better than digital ones. 
Crawford believes it is important to focus on one thing at a time. This helps us pay attention to what matters and makes us feel better.

"What do you do for work?" This is a common question. We often talk about our jobs. I am a philosopher, and it is hard to explain my job. Saying "I am a philosopher" can sound strange. People might think philosophers know special truths. This is not true. Philosophers are like everyone else. 
Why do people think philosophers are different? One reason is that philosophers think a lot about life. A long time ago, a Greek philosopher named Aristotle said thinking about life is very good. Another Greek philosopher, Socrates, said we should think about our lives to make them better. 
Thinking about life does not mean reading many books. It means looking at our daily life and making sure it is good. It is important to share what we learn with others. 
Today, philosophy is often in universities. It can seem far from real life. Many people do not understand it. This is because philosophers write in difficult books. They talk to other experts, not to everyone. 
I work in ethics, a part of philosophy. Ethics is about what is right and wrong. It is important to ask if something is good or bad. But philosophy is more than this. It helps us think about our actions and beliefs. By thinking about these things, we can help everyone.

'People who love food think a lot about what and how we eat. In the past, talking about food was not very important in philosophy. Sometimes, philosophers used eating as a way to talk about other things, like learning. One famous philosopher, Epicurus, talked about enjoying life and avoiding pain. Today, people think of him when they talk about enjoying food and drink. We see his name in restaurants and food shops. Food is important in our culture. It comes from history and we share it with others. We eat with friends and family. Food is everywhere in our lives, so it is interesting to think about. Some people write about food and say what they think about it. They are not special, but they are good at talking about food. We need to think more about how we taste food. We often talk about art, like paintings and music, as beautiful. Some people say food can be art too. But food is eaten and gone, unlike art that stays. There are also questions about what food we should eat, like organic or vegetarian. These choices show what we believe is right. Cooking at home is different from cooking in restaurants. At home, we cook for people we love. In restaurants, chefs cook for their job. Food can also help people from different cultures understand each other. We can learn about others by eating their food and eating together. This helps us make friends from different places.'

Rob Daviau is from the US. He makes special board games called 'legacy' games. When he was a child, he played many board games. But he thought they were not fun or hard enough anymore. So, he wanted to change them. He asked, "Can board games have a story? Can choices in one game change the next game?" 
He changed a board game called Risk. He made a new game called Risk Legacy. In this game, choices change the game forever. Players might have to tear cards or write on the board. Sometimes, they open packets with new rules. The game is played over many sessions. Players remember past games and say, "You did this!"
Rob also worked on a new version of a game called Pandemic. In this game, players work together to stop diseases. His next game was SeaFall. SeaFall is about ships and exploring new places. 
Making legacy games is hard. Designers must think about all player choices. They use testers to see how the game works. Jaime Barriga tested SeaFall. He said it takes a lot of time. Sometimes, the game works well at first, but later it breaks. Then, they must fix it.
Many people did not think legacy games would be popular. Rob thought only a few people would like them. But many players loved them. Russell Chapman said they are exciting and new. Ben Hogg liked the adventure in the games. He said it is like watching a new movie.
Legacy games are like TV shows. Rob wanted to write for TV, but he made games instead. He likes telling stories. Matt Leacock, who made Pandemic, said making legacy games is like writing a book. You need to know the start and end of the story.
Rob is happy to see others make legacy games. But he thinks people will soon want something new. Colby Dauch, who works with SeaFall, thinks legacy games change how we see board games.

'One night, an octopus named Inky escaped from his tank at New Zealand’s National Aquarium. He moved across the floor and went into a small drain that led to the Pacific Ocean. Many people shared this story online. People like stories about animals escaping, like rats and llamas, because it makes us think animals are like us. Octopuses are very smart. They can open jars, recognize faces, and use coconut shells for protection. Some people think animals are not like humans, but Dr. Frans de Waal says animals are smarter than we think. He studies animals like gorillas and chimpanzees. He says animals can think about the past and future, show empathy, and understand others. In the past, people thought animals were smart. Charles Darwin, who studied evolution, said animals and humans are not so different. In the 20th century, people started to think animals were like machines. But now, we are learning more about animal intelligence. Dr. de Waal says we should test animals in ways that suit them. For example, squirrels are good at remembering where they hide nuts. Inky's story shows us that animals are smart, even if we don't know all the details. Dr. de Waal did an experiment with monkeys. He gave them cucumbers or grapes. Monkeys who got cucumbers were upset when others got grapes. A video of this experiment showed people that animals can feel envy. This helps us understand animal minds better.'

Robots are machines that can do work. In the past, robots were only in stories. Now, robots are real and changing how we work. Robots have been used in car factories for many years. But soon, robots will be in many more places. Some people think robots will do most jobs in the next 50 years. But many people also think their own jobs will stay the same. This is not true. All jobs will change because of robots.
For example, in Australia, a robot called Hadrian X can build walls with bricks very fast. In the USA, a robot named Tally helps in supermarkets. It checks if products are on the shelves and have the right price. Robots like these will change many jobs.
Some people say robots will make new jobs for people who can fix and program them. But others worry that robots will take away jobs that need people to talk and work together. Dr. Jing Bing Zhang studies robots and jobs. He says robots will work with people and other robots soon. Big companies will have special people to manage robots. But there will not be enough workers with the right skills for these jobs.
Dr. Zhang says people need to learn new skills to keep their jobs. Robots will also be in our homes and do new things. This is a big chance for companies, but it also means we need new rules to keep us safe. Many jobs might go away, so learning about science and technology is important. This will help people find new jobs in the future.

George Mallory, a famous climber, was asked why he wanted to climb Mount Everest. He said, "Because it's there." People often wonder why someone would do something so dangerous. Some think climbing is about adventure and fun. A writer named Tejada-Flores talked about different types of climbing, like climbing big mountains or small rocks. Each type has its own rules. Many climbers love the feeling of freedom, but sometimes climbing can feel limiting, like when stuck in a tent during a storm. Joe Fitschen, another climber, thinks climbing is in our nature. He says we like to take on challenges. Brian Treanor, a teacher, believes climbing helps us learn important things like courage and respect for nature. Some climbers think climbing without help is better, but it can be more dangerous. Climbing also helps people focus and feel calm, like in Zen philosophy. This is why many people are drawn to climbing.

Alfred Brendel is a famous piano player. He played piano for many years. He is very smart and serious. He played music from Europe. He did not teach many students. One day, a young boy named Kit Armstrong asked Brendel for lessons. At first, Brendel said no. But then he heard Kit play the piano. Kit played very well. Brendel decided to teach him. Kit is now 19 years old. He likes to learn new things like languages and math. He also writes music. Brendel thinks Kit is very good at listening and playing music. Brendel is careful not to say Kit will be a great pianist too soon. Brendel is now 80 years old. He does not play piano in public anymore. He is happy with what he has done in his life.

When I was a child, I thought gardens were beautiful places. My grandad's garden was not in a busy city. It was next to a river. You could hear the water and birds singing. I thought all gardens were like this—quiet and peaceful. Grandad's garden was simple. He did not have a greenhouse like some neighbors. Their greenhouses were made from old windows.
At home, my dad was sometimes quiet. He liked funny things and had special phrases. He said, "It's immaterial to me," which means "I don't mind." He left school without finishing and became a plumber. He did not love plumbing. He and my mom once thought about moving to Canada, but they stayed. Dad was good at fixing things at home, like making bookshelves.
My parents moved house only once. My mom liked to change furniture. One day, we got a piano. I wanted to like it, but it scared me. It had two shiny candlesticks. My mom said they were too fancy and took them away. My sister got piano lessons, not me. My mom said I would not practice.
I liked going to the river. I would take a fishing net and look for fish. I wore old sandals and took them off by the river. I tried to catch fish, but they did not live long at home, so I put them back in the river.
I wanted to leave school early. One day, my dad said there was a job for an apprentice gardener. He thought I might like it. Dad did not like gardening, but he saw I loved it. I think he hoped it would be good for me.

Lawrence MacEwen lives on a small island in Scotland called the Isle of Muck. The wind is very strong, but Lawrence is happy on his island. He shows me the other islands nearby. He points and says, "That island is Eigg. The one next to it is the Isle of Rum. It rains a lot there." I see the rain on Rum's big mountains. Lawrence says, "I have to move my sheep," and we walk down the hill. He tells me about the island: it is 3 km long and 1.5 km wide. His family has lived there for 3000 years. Lawrence's dog, Tie, helps with the sheep, but sometimes Tie makes mistakes. Lawrence's family runs the island. His wife, Jenny, helps with the farm. His son, Colin, takes care of the cottages. His daughter, Mary, and her husband, Toby, run the hotel. Their children play on the island and sail boats. The island has no electricity sometimes, and there is no mobile phone service. Mary says, "You can get phone service on the hill, but most people stop using their phones after a few days." A boat brings food and musicians to the island. The musicians play music, and everyone enjoys it. Lawrence tells me how he met Jenny. Her father bought a farm on another island, and Jenny went to manage it. She did not know much about farming, but she was good at typing. I eat fresh fish from the island. The next day, I wait for the ferry to leave the island. Many ferries were canceled before because of bad weather. If my ferry does not come, I will stay on Muck for two more days, which I secretly hope for.

The video game industry used to be small and mostly for computer experts. People thought it was just a hobby for young people. Now, it is a big and serious industry. Making video games is hard. It needs many people and a lot of time. It is not easy to get a job in this industry, but it is growing.
Jim Donelly, who works for a games magazine, says it is hard to work in big companies. But the industry needs more game designers. Not just the bosses, but also people who make small parts of the game. Jim says the best way to get into the industry is to make games. You need to show you can make something.
John Field, another expert, says it is not easy. Many people want to work in games, but not everyone has the skills. A good course in games can help. Most game designers start as programmers or artists. They like all kinds of entertainment and art. They are not just fans; they are interested in the future of games. Knowing people in the industry can also help.
Games are not just for kids anymore. Families play games together. Phones have many games, and social media has games too. John thinks there are many chances to grow in this industry. Games are fun and can also teach us things.

'When I was a child, I loved to play football. My dad helped me, but he did not force me. I had a friend whose dad was very strict. My friend stopped playing football because of this. I am happy my dad was not like that. When I score a goal from far away, people say it is luck, but it is not. I practiced a lot since I was a kid. The best players practice for many years. I learned how to play well. I teach kids to enjoy learning football skills. At school, I played many sports like baseball and basketball. I know school is important, but I only thought about football. I want my son to learn and read books. He is too young to sit still, but we try. At the start of my football career, the manager helped us young players. He did not make a big deal about it. We knew we had to work hard. I scored in the first game, but we lost. A TV presenter said, ‘You can’t win with kids.’ We knew we had to do better. I trust my friends and family. I have a lot of money, but it can be a problem. People ask why my mom still works. I help my parents with money. I paid for their house and bought them a car. My mom loves her job as a hairdresser. I like to help people around me. After I stop playing football, I want to take a break. I want to go skiing, but I cannot now because I might get hurt and not be able to play football.'

Sam Carter helped us find a place to live at Reef Point. Sam worked for my dad in Los Angeles. My dad couldn't write in Los Angeles, so Sam found us a cheap place to stay. Reef Point was quiet in the summer because of sea fogs. People preferred to go to La Carmella, a nicer place nearby. Only people with little money or surfers came to Reef Point. When the weather got hot, more people came. My dad was busy writing, so I spent time on the beach with my dog, Rusty. Rusty came to us when we moved to Reef Point. I gave him water, and he stayed. My dad joked that Rusty thought we belonged to him. Rusty liked to dig and swim. He sometimes brought me things from the beach, like shoes or towels, which I returned to their owners. One day, my dad went to Los Angeles, and Rusty and I watched surfers. One surfer was very good. She talked to me and asked why I didn't surf. I said I had no surfboard or money. She asked if I was British and if I was visiting. I said I lived there and my dad was writing a movie script. She asked about my dad's name, and I said Rufus Marsh. She knew his book, "Tall as the Morning," and was interested in me after that.

Violet Hetherington was in a long line at the dock in Southampton. She was waiting to get on a big ship called the Queen Caroline. Her friend Annie told her to come late, but now Violet thought that was bad advice. There was a problem with the computers, and everyone was upset. They paid a lot of money for this trip and wanted it to be nice.
Violet wanted to leave, but she couldn't find her phone. She needed it to call the taxi company to see if she left it there. Her son Harry always told her to be careful with her phone. She asked a nice couple behind her if she could use their phone. She called Harry and left a message to ask their neighbor Kristina to check if the phone was at home.
Finally, the line moved, and Violet got on the ship. She didn't like the ship's entrance. It looked like a hotel trying too hard to be fancy. There were shiny fake wood panels, big chandeliers, and carpets like in airports. She went to the elevator, which was full of tired people. She got out on the twelfth floor and was happy to see her room had a balcony. She paid extra for it because she wanted to see the sea.

John Maloof bought a box of old photo negatives at an auction. He wanted pictures for a book about Portage Park in Chicago, USA. Instead, he found 30,000 photos by Vivian Maier, a street photographer. Maloof now has many of Maier's things, like cameras, films, and photos, in his home. He did not know what he had bought at first. Maloof is a flea market seller and could have sold it all. Maloof and his friend Anthony Rydzon are learning about Maier's life. They talked to families she worked for as a nanny and people from a shop where she developed film. Maier was born in 1926 in New York and lived in France as a child. She came back to New York in 1951 and moved to Chicago in 1956 to work as a nanny. Maier was private and always had a camera. She wore big coats, hats, and strong shoes. On her day off, she took photos all day. Maier liked movies and politics. She was not very social but talked to people on the street and recorded them. She loved taking photos and did it for herself, not for money. Her photos show women, children, old people, and the poor. Photography expert Larry Silverman finds her pictures interesting. He wonders if she made her own style or copied others. Maloof is still looking at all the negatives he has. He was not interested in photography before finding Maier's work. Now, he takes his own photos. Maloof wants people to know about Vivian Maier and her work.

'When a book is called ambitious, it often means it didn't fully succeed. But this is not true for Eleanor Catton's book, The Luminaries. I talked to her in the UK when her book was very popular. She was calm, even though she was still in her twenties. She had just come from Germany and was going back to New Zealand the next day. She told me a story about being stopped at passport control and asked to prove she was a writer. She showed her book. The officer asked, ‘What’s it about?’ This is a hard question for a writer. The Luminaries is set in the 1860s in New Zealand. There are many crimes, and 12 men try to solve them. The story is very complex. Catton wanted to write a murder mystery, not a history book, but found the past gave more chances for problems for her characters. The book is over 800 pages because she wanted to give each of the 20 main characters a good part. When I ask how it feels to be successful at a young age, she says it is nice because everyone in her small country feels part of the success. She says, ‘What is annoying is when people think I am not trying to do something deep in the book.’ She wanted to write the book like a spiral, with each part half the length of the one before. It gets faster as it goes. I ask if it matters if readers notice this. She says, ‘I wanted to make a book with patterns that don’t matter, but if you care, you can see them.’ Even with its special structure, The Luminaries is an exciting murder mystery. She says she didn’t plan the book before writing. ‘I would write myself into a corner, then see how I could get out.’ She also wanted the book to be fun for readers. We talk about her love for TV drama series. I ask if she wants to write for TV. ‘That could be pretty cool,’ she says. She is very excited when talking about writing and New Zealand. ‘When I come to Britain, my imagination changes because it is a different place. I see why writers leave New Zealand for busy places, to be around many people.’ But for now, New Zealand is her home. I hope it gives her ideas for more books.'

Jonny Kinkead liked to make things when he was a boy. He used tools in his dad's garage. He also liked to play the guitar. Now, for 40 years, he makes guitars by hand. Jonny loves guitars. He says, "How can two pieces of wood make a beautiful sound?" He learned to play guitar at 11 years old. At 16, he wanted a bass guitar. Instead of buying one, he made it himself. He learned how different wood makes different sounds. Jonny and his brothers also made model boats and planes. Their father taught them how to use tools. Jonny fixed instruments for his friends, too. 
Jonny's bass guitar was good, but he did not think about making guitars for a job. He liked painting and sculpture. After school, he studied architecture at university. But he left because he wanted to do something else. He thought guitar-making was like sculpture. He could make things people use. 
Jonny started making guitars for a living. For ten years, he also cleaned windows to make money. At first, he sold guitars for just the cost of materials. Later, he became known as a good guitar-maker and could charge more. He still only makes ten guitars a year. 
In the beginning, Jonny went to music festivals to show his guitars. He wanted musicians to try them and tell others. He learned how to price his guitars by talking to musicians. 
Today, it is easier for new guitar-makers in the UK. Before, people thought only American guitars were good. Now, UK guitars are respected. Jonny says new guitar-makers should take courses. But he also thinks learning by trying is important. He says, "Look at other instruments and try different things. If you learn by yourself, you learn everything."

English people often talk about the weather. This is very common in English conversations. A famous writer, Dr. Johnson, said, "When two Englishmen meet, their first talk is of the weather." This was true 200 years ago and is still true today. Many people think English people talk about the weather because they find it interesting. But this is not true. The weather in England is not very exciting. There are no big storms or tornadoes. 
Some people, like the writer Bill Bryson, say the English weather is boring. Others, like broadcaster Jeremy Paxman, say it is interesting because it is always changing. But both are missing the point. English people talk about the weather to start conversations. It is a way to say "hello" or to fill a quiet moment. 
When someone says, "Nice day, isn’t it?" or "Ooh, isn’t it cold?" they are not really asking about the weather. They are just starting a conversation. This is like how monkeys groom each other to be friendly. 
There are three main times when English people talk about the weather: 
1. As a greeting.
2. To start a conversation.
3. When there is nothing else to talk about.
Because of this, it seems like English people talk about the weather a lot. But really, it is just a way to be friendly and talk to each other.

Alice Leader was in front of Hadrian’s Wall in Britain. She was talking to her class of 12- and 13-year-olds. She told them the Romans built the wall 120 km long and 5 meters high 1900 years ago. The students chose this trip instead of going to Spain, Greece, or France. They wanted to know why the wall was built. Alice did not have a good answer. She wanted a book about life at the Wall in Roman times but could not find one. So, she decided to write it herself. Alice stopped teaching after 31 years and started writing in 2001. She said teaching is like acting and is hard work. Writing is exciting but not as tiring. Her old teaching friends are jealous because she still connects with children through her books. Alice wants to write books that are not too dark or too much fantasy. She likes to teach English and History together. She loves when children go from bored to interested. Writing is like teaching for her. She started writing because her sons were leaving home and her head teacher suggested a writing course. She wrote a story about a Roman couple and their baby. The course students liked her story and said she should publish it. Alice asked for a year off from school to write her first book. Her husband, Zachary Leader, helped her edit the book. He reads her work and helps make it better. Alice says they work well together.

Jonny and Alistair Brownlee are brothers. They are champion triathletes. A newspaper and a TV company asked them to race for charity. Jonny would drive a car, and Alistair would ride a mountain bike. The race was in the Yorkshire Dales in England. Jonny said, "I am excited. I can stay warm in the car." Alistair wore winter cycling clothes. He joked, "I might stop for tea because I know Jonny's driving."
The race started at Semerwater lake and ended at Fleet Moss. Alistair had to go up a steep hill first. They shook hands and started. Alistair rode his bike up the hill. Jonny drove the car. Soon, Jonny saw a big tractor on the road. He said, "If Alistair wins, it's because of this farmer!" After the tractor moved, Jonny drove on.
Alistair had to carry his bike up the hill. Sheep watched him. Then he reached the top and rode fast. Jonny had trouble with narrow roads in the village. He drove slowly through a stream. Then he drove fast to the finish line.
Alistair was also close to the finish. He rode fast and stopped at the line. He asked, "Is Jonny here?" The crowd said, "No." Alistair was happy. Jonny arrived a few minutes later. He said, "Well done," but he was disappointed.

'When you play on Centre Court at Wimbledon, it is very quiet. You bounce the ball on the soft grass. You hit the ball and hear the sound. The grass, the old stadium, the players in white clothes, and the quiet people watching make you feel like you are in a different world. The quiet helps me play better. I try to think only about the game and the point I am playing. When a point is over, there is noise: people clap and cheer. I hear them, but it feels far away. I do not think about the many people watching me. I am very focused. In 2008, I played Roger Federer in the Wimbledon final. It was a big match for me. I always wanted to play at Wimbledon. My uncle Toni, my coach, told me it was the most important tournament. When I was 14, I dreamed of playing and winning there. Before 2008, I played and lost to Federer twice. In 2006, I was happy to play, even though I lost. But in 2007, losing was very hard. I knew I could play better. I cried a lot after that match. Losing hurts more when you have a chance to win. My uncle Toni usually does not comfort me, but he told me not to cry. He said there would be more chances. I told him he did not understand. I thought it was my last chance. I know a sports career is short, and I want to do my best. Some moments are very important, and I missed one in 2007. But Toni was right. I had another chance in 2008. I learned from my loss. I was sure I would win this time. The night before the final, I had dinner with family and friends. We did not talk about the match. They knew I was thinking about it in my mind. I needed to keep my focus until the match started.'

'A young Englishwoman named Jane Goodall went to Africa in April 1957. She loved Africa and spent most of her life there. Jane was a citizen, journalist, scientist, activist, and environmentalist. In 1963, she became famous for her work with chimpanzees. She wrote books for children and adults. One of her books, "In the Shadow of Man," is very popular and has been translated into 47 languages. Jane Goodall is a well-known female scientist. She helped us understand chimpanzees better. Before her work, people did not know that chimpanzees eat meat or use tools. They also did not know that chimpanzees have emotions like humans. Jane's book, "The Chimpanzees of Gombe," is important for chimpanzee research. Her study of chimpanzees in Gombe, Nigeria, is a great scientific achievement. Jane Goodall changed how we study animals and how we think about ourselves. As a child, Jane was curious. When she was five, she wanted to know how hens lay eggs. She hid in a henhouse for five hours to find out. This curiosity helped her become a great biologist.'

Shirley Ford is a voice actor. She can speak like a young boy, a tired mom, an old Scottish woman, and even an alien. People know her voices from TV shows and cartoons. She also does voices for work videos about health and safety. Shirley says doing voiceovers is not just about funny voices. You have to make the script interesting for people who can't see you. Many famous actors want to do voiceovers, but it's not easy for them because they are used to acting with their whole bodies.
Shirley went to drama school to become an actor. She sang for TV ads sometimes. One day, someone asked her to try a voice for a cartoon rabbit. She thought it was funny but tried it and got the job. She found out she was good at voices and decided to do more voiceover work. In one film, she did voices for the main character and her family.
Women often do voices for children because their voices are lighter. Shirley learns new voices by watching children's TV. She does many types of voice work, like videos for schools and ads for vacuum cleaners. She says smiling while talking makes your voice sound happy. She enjoys working with other actors in cartoons.
Getting voice work is hard, and you need a good showreel, which is a recording of your voices. Shirley says you need to work hard and not give up. She suggests going to special classes for voiceovers. Shirley loves voices and sometimes talks in different voices even at home. Her children are used to it.

'People often ask me how I became a cartoonist. Being a cartoonist is a job many kids dream about, like being a race car driver. But most people choose other jobs, like being a lawyer or working in a car factory. It seems funny to think you can make money by drawing little pictures, but some people do it. Many cartoonists have wanted to draw for a long time. When I was a child, I loved comics and drew for school papers. I studied graphic design in college. After college, I showed my drawings to different companies. I was lucky to find a newspaper that wanted cartoons about local news. I drew some ideas, and they bought them. Soon, I was making enough money to live. To be a cartoonist, you don’t need a university degree or a lot of money. You just need your brain, your hand, and something to draw with. But it’s not easy. It’s a hard job, and you should only do it if you really love it. It’s easier to get a regular job that pays the bills and gives you time for family and hobbies. The more things you can do, the better chance you have to make money with your art. I have done political cartoons, comic strips, and comic books. I have also been a writer and a designer. I take any job because you can learn a lot from work you don’t really want to do. It helps to be smart and curious about everything. In the past, many cartoonists worked for newspapers and magazines. Now, cartooning is more like running your own business. You have to make and sell your work. Cartoonists with good business skills often do better than very talented artists. Some people worry about others stealing their ideas. But it’s more likely that no one will be interested in your work. If someone does take your cartoon and it becomes popular online, it can be a good thing!'

'Twenty years ago, I was moving to a new house. I decided to throw away an electric guitar. My dad gave it to me for my 16th birthday. It was black and made in Japan. I usually keep old things, but I wanted to throw this guitar away. I took it to the rubbish dump. A young man saw me and asked, "Are you really throwing that away?" I said yes. He asked if he could have it, and I said yes. Later, I felt sad about it. A few months ago, I got an email from a man named Keith Rushton. He said, "I have your electric guitar." The guitar was sold many times, but Keith found my name on it. He found me online and asked if I wanted to buy it back. I was very happy. Keith's price was fair. My dad used to put name stickers on my things. My parents wanted me to learn classical guitar. I liked the sound, but I was not good at it. So, I played the electric guitar instead. It was the time of punk music, and you didn't have to play well to be a rock star. When I got my guitar back, I remembered my birthday in 1978. My parents gave me the guitar. It felt smaller than I remembered. I played it again. My fingers remembered the chords. Now, I want to play in a band. My son plays the saxophone. Maybe we can play together. Or maybe I can find other people like me. We could call our band 'The Regainers'!'

'People are talking a lot about sleep now. I wrote a book about people who cannot sleep well. Sleep is very important for our mind and body. People who cannot sleep know this best. It is good that sleep is getting attention. But what about dreams? We do not hear much about dreams. When we wake up early, we lose dreams. The last part of sleep is called REM, where we dream the most. Good sleepers spend a lot of time in REM. Dreams are important. In 1953, researchers found REM sleep. They thought dreams help us understand our mind. But it is not that simple. Now, researchers look at the physical side of dreams. There is not much agreement on dreams. Dreams help us be creative. People like actors and writers use dreams more. Dreams help us think in new ways. For example, when people wake up from REM, they have more original ideas. Dreams help us think better. Creativity is not just for artists. We all need to think well in our lives. This is why we need to dream.'

Susie Ray left London 20 years ago. She moved to a small town by the sea in south-west England. In her studio, you see empty frames and photos of her two daughters. Susie is a copyist artist. She paints copies of famous paintings. She can paint like Renoir, Monet, and Van Gogh. Her copies look so real that art experts think they are the originals. The real paintings cost millions, but Susie's copies cost between a few hundred pounds and £12,000. Many people want her paintings. Some people pretend her copies are real. Susie puts her name on the back of her paintings. She does not want to break the law by selling fakes. Susie used to work as an illustrator for a garden. She did not earn much money, but it helped her learn. Now, she tells young artists to learn to draw well. Susie likes painting French impressionists like Manet and Degas. She says their art is hard to copy because it is both quick and careful. Susie does not paint her own art often. She tried once, but it looked like a photo. Susie is very careful and wants her work to be perfect.

Ellen MacArthur loved the sea. She wanted to be the fastest sailor. As a child, she dreamed of sailing. Her boat was like a friend. She felt free on the ocean. On land, life felt boring. People asked her many questions about her races. She wanted to sail again soon.
Ellen raced alone around the world. She came second in a big race called the Vendée Globe. Her boat was called Kingfisher. She lived on the boat for 94 days. She showed me her small cabin. It was her home and work place. She planned everything carefully. She had freeze-dried food and a small gas stove. She took care of her boat because it was her world.
Ellen now thinks the world is like a boat. It is small and needs care. She went to South Georgia, an island in the south Atlantic. She helped with a bird survey. She saw old whaling stations and thought about how people take too much from the world.
Ellen wants to save the planet. She says we must use less coal, oil, and gas. These things are running out. She talks about re-using things. She visits factories and talks to people about using less. She started the Ellen MacArthur Foundation. It helps young people think about a better future.
Ellen misses sailing. She loved the adventure. But now, she wants to help the world. She says this work is more important than being the fastest sailor.

Jordan Romero is 13 years old. He wants to climb Mount Everest. If he does it, he will be the youngest person to do so. Jordan wants to show other kids that they can do big things too. His team includes his dad, Paul, and his mom, Karen. They call themselves 'Team Romero'. Jordan also wants to climb the highest mountains on each continent. He has already climbed five of them. Some people think it is not a good idea for a 13-year-old to climb Everest. They say he might not be ready. But his parents believe in him. They think he is strong and ready. Jordan likes the challenge. He says he wants to reach his goal. Today, many people talk about their adventures online. Jordan also shares his story. If he wants to stop climbing and play basketball, his parents will support him.

'When you see a teenager with an MP3 player, they are probably not listening to classical music. Many people know the names of pop groups, but not many know who Brahms was. I am studying music at university, but my classmates do not know much about classical music either. If you do not know the music, you probably do not have any recordings of it. Only 3% of concert tickets sold last year were for classical music, and classical music CDs do not sell many copies. This is surprising to me. Why do people not like classical music anymore? Some older people think TV and video games are the reason, but I do not agree. Classical music is not very interesting to most people, especially teenagers. Teenagers buy a lot of music and concert tickets. I know some teenagers who like classical music, but they are few. I play in an orchestra, but I am not a big fan of classical music. I like many types of music, but I do not listen to much classical music. Why do teenagers not like classical music? Classical music changes mood a lot, and teenagers like things fast. We also have trouble paying attention for a long time, and classical music is often long. Pop music is simple and easy to listen to. It also talks about things teenagers care about. In the past, families played music together at home, and people went to concerts to hear music. Now, we can find any music online, but we do not often listen to classical music. You do not hear classical music in shops. One of my teachers says more people go to classical concerts now, but not many are teenagers. In my orchestra, we play in many places, but the audience is mostly older people. Teenagers often do not like what their parents like. Some people say schools are to blame, but many kids like playing classical music in school orchestras. They practice a lot, but when they relax, they listen to pop music.'

Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mom's car and looked at Almonside School. "I'll make you sorry I came here," she said to the school. Her mom didn't hear her. Bonnie's mom knew how she felt. Almonside School was strange, with many buildings hidden in the trees. Mrs. Wyndham saw signs: Science block, gym, riding center. "Riding center," Bonnie said, interested. "Headmaster's office," her mom said. "This way." Bonnie followed her mom on a path between trees. "Walk next to me, not behind me," her mom said, tired. But Bonnie didn't walk next to her.
Soon, her mom talked to the headmaster in his office. Bonnie waited outside. Suddenly, Bonnie stood up. "Why should I just sit here?" she thought. "I'll leave soon anyway," she thought. She left and went to the riding center. There was a nice building for horses and a big place for indoor riding. Bonnie looked around, but no one was there. She liked horses and treated them with respect. The horses looked well cared for. She walked and looked at each horse. "I know what they're doing here," she told a small pony.
Then she saw a special horse. "You're the best!" she said. He was brown with some white. Bonnie liked lively horses. "I feel like we met before," she said, petting him. "In my dreams, I rode you in a big competition." His name was Maverick. She wanted to ride him. "Where can I find a bridle and saddle?" she wondered. She found the room with riding gear unlocked. She put a saddle on Maverick and forgot about her mom and the headmaster.
When she sat on Maverick outside, she felt like a queen. Her old school called her Queen Bee, and she laughed. "You're the best horse I've ever ridden, Maverick," she said. "I know about horses." She made him walk, then trot. "If I stay here, we can be great friends," she said. She rode around the paddock. The ride was exciting, and the wind felt nice on her face. She knew Maverick trusted her, and she felt he would jump well.

Cody Simpson is a 15-year-old boy from Australia. He is a singer. Cody started playing the guitar when he was six years old. He began writing songs at seven. Cody also liked swimming and surfing. When he was 13, he put videos of himself singing on the internet. Many people liked his videos and wanted more. Cody was also a good swimmer and trained with top coaches. But then music companies wanted to work with him. Cody had to choose: stay in Australia and swim or move to the US and sing. He chose to move to the US with his family. It was a hard choice for him. Cody's family supports him, but they stay out of the spotlight. Cody sometimes worries about his little brother and sister because they travel a lot. But his family always supports him. Cody is happy to sing for many fans around the world. He knows it is a special chance.

I woke up and looked out my bedroom window. I saw the river and the ice. The ice was shiny in the sun. I worked hard last week with other people in the town. We put sandbags by the river to stop water from coming into the buildings. My back hurt from the work. I saw a boy on the ice. I did not know him. He was trying to walk on the ice. I put on my kayaking clothes. I have a special silver chain from my grandfather. He got it from South America. I keep it in my pocket. I also have his diary. I read it before I sleep. I went to the kitchen. "Good morning, Rex," my mom said. I took a banana. "You are up early," she said. "Be careful." "Thanks, Mom," I said. I walked down the hall. I almost bumped into Grandpa. "Watch where you’re going!" he said. "Where are you going?" "I’m going kayaking," I said. Grandpa was angry. He said, "Why train? You didn’t win." I took a deep breath. Grandpa went to the bathroom. Mom said, "Don’t mind him." I used to think Grandpa was a hero. He was in National Geographic magazine. I have my own trophies now. I want to be in the magazine too. Mom said, "Have a good session, Rex." I smiled and said, "It will be warmer in South America." I ate my banana and went outside to the boathouse.

Mum held Jess's arm. "Come with me," she said. Jess followed her to the study. On the table was a painting by Grandpa. It was not finished. "Do you know about this?" Mum asked. Jess shook her head. "I have never seen it before," she said. The painting showed a river. It was not a real river, maybe a dream river. The picture was strange but beautiful. There were no animals or people. It felt right that way. Jess thought about autumn coming after summer. Mum spoke again. "It has a name." Grandpa never named his pictures. Mum turned the picture over. Jess read the words: "River Boy." The words felt important to her, but she did not know why. She looked at Mum. "There is no boy." "Yes, strange," Mum said. "Maybe he will add the boy later. I asked him about it." "Mum! You should not have asked." "I know, but it is an unusual picture. You can guess what he said." Jess knew. Grandpa would say, "A painting has its own life. We understand it or we don't. Artists should not explain their work." Mum laughed. "Something like that. I hoped you knew about this painting. You are like a muse for him." "Muse?" Jess asked. "Someone who inspires an artist," Mum said. Jess knew the word. Grandpa used it when she watched him paint. He said the muse was not kind to him or he needed to be nice to the muse. Jess thought a muse was a goddess, not a person. "He does not need me to inspire him," Jess said. "He has painted all his life."

'This morning, I did not plan to cut a hole in my bedroom carpet. It was not an accident, but it could have been. Maybe if I tripped with Dad's knife in my hand, the knife could have cut the carpet. I did not want to damage the carpet. I did not wake up thinking, ‘Today I will cut a hole in my carpet.’ It just seemed like a good idea at the time. Later, I wondered why I thought that, but it was too late. This happens to me a lot. I was trying to fit my corner cabinet into a corner. Gran gave me the cabinet when she moved to a flat. It is small, white, with pink and blue flowers, and has tiny glass doors. Gran kept ornaments in it. I keep shells and stones in it. I love the cabinet. But it is a corner cabinet, shaped like a triangle. It needs a corner. My bedroom has only two corners because it is small and shaped like cheese. The big bedroom is Mum and Dad’s; the back one is my sister Angela’s; the one over the garage is my brother Tom’s; and the small one is mine. Mum says when Angela goes to University, Tom can have her room, and I can have his. But Angela is only fifteen, so I will be in my small room for a long time. I like my room. It is cosy, like a nest. The roof slopes down, and the window is at floor level. The problem is, there are not enough corners! My bed is in one corner, and my wardrobe is in the other. I tried to fit Gran’s cabinet between the roof and the floor, but it was a little too tall. I thought, if I cannot cut the cabinet, maybe I can cut the carpet. It seemed like a good solution. Dad calls this lateral thinking. He always tells us to ‘think outside the box’. That is what I was doing!'

The story 'The Borrowers' is about a family of very small people. They live in the walls and floors of a house. They take things from big people to live. I was asked to make a TV show of the story. It was hard because people love the book and have strong ideas about it. I used the book's drawings to help me. The author wanted the show to be from the Borrowers' view, not the humans'. This made filming harder. The Borrowers are much smaller than humans. So, we had to film from far away to show their size. The crew had to film close to the ground to show the Borrowers' view. They wore out many jeans doing this! We never lifted the cameras high, except for special shots. It was hard to make the Borrowers look small with big things around them. We found a special way to do this. After the show, a famous director, George Lucas, called to ask how we did it. We built a set of the Borrowers' home with big objects to make the actors look small. It was fun. The actors had to carry big things like giant scissors. It made everyone laugh. There was a scene where the Borrowers go down a drain. The actors had to go down a tunnel with water. It was scary for them. The costumes were important. They were made from heavy cloth like dolls' clothes. The lead actress couldn't bend or sit in her dress. The lead actor's trousers were made from a rug. It was hot during filming, and the actors didn't like the costumes. We filmed the actors in front of a blue screen. They had to pretend things were there. I drew pictures to show how each scene should look. I made 2,000 drawings. We didn't have much money, so I worked at night. Once, I filmed a scene with no film in the camera! But in the end, the show was good and showed the magic of the books.

'Mom stops the car at my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around nervously. I tell her, ‘Everything’s going to be fine.’ She kisses her finger and touches my cheek. Then she drives away. I am alone at this new school. I wanted to come here to meet real kids. I walk into the school office. ‘Hi, I need my schedule please,’ I say to the secretary. ‘Name?’ she asks. ‘Desert McGraw,’ I say. She looks confused. ‘Oh,’ she says and types on her keyboard. ‘What grade?’ ‘Eleventh,’ I say. ‘One second, it’s printing,’ she says. She gives me the paper. English Literature is my first class. I like English. It is my favorite subject. I go to Room 214 on the second floor. I hear the teacher calling names. I sit at a desk. The girl next to me smiles. ‘Nice shoes,’ she whispers. I look at my shoes. ‘Thanks,’ I say. The teacher calls my name, ‘Desert McGraw?’ ‘Here,’ I say. The teacher smiles and says her name is Ms. Smigla. She talks a lot and gives us papers about the class. Then she lets us talk to each other. ‘Why did you move here?’ the girl asks. I think about what to say. ‘My dad had to move,’ I tell her. ‘What does he do?’ she asks. ‘He’s an artist,’ I say. ‘Cool. I’m Becca,’ she says. She doesn’t care much. That’s good.'

'American teenage girls have many things to do. They need to be good at school, have a job, and help others. Boys and girls cannot just go to school and do nothing else. They have a lot of homework, tests, and activities. They also have jobs and chores at home. People sometimes think teenagers are lazy and only care about themselves. But this is not true for everyone. Teenagers use their phones a lot, but not just for fun. They use them to help with school and to stay in touch. Teenagers are busy all day. They start early in the morning and finish late at night. They do not get enough sleep. Many teenagers are tired at school. Some teenagers, like Lindamarie Olsen, use their free time to help others. She likes to volunteer and help her community. Teenagers today work hard and do many things. In the future, they will keep doing great things.'

'The teenage members of the Earth to Sky Calculus Club live in Bishop, a small town in the US near the Sierra Nevada mountains. They have sent over fifty balloons high into the sky, about 35 km up. This is a science project and an adventure. I join them one weekend in late spring. They are going to release a balloon to try and see shooting stars. Shooting stars happen when a rock or metal from space enters the earth's air, making a light. As it gets dark, the teenagers attach a $5 lunch box to the balloon. Inside is a camera, a tool to measure height, and a thermometer. Two GPS trackers are on the lunch box to help find it later. A gas tank fills the balloon, making it as big as a small car. An older boy drove a long way to get the gas. ‘I didn’t really mind,’ he says. For kids in this club, that’s normal. Finally, it's time to let the balloon go. ‘Five, four, three, two, one,’ they say, and the balloon goes up. Some of them run and watch it with flashlights until it is gone. There is quiet and wonder. Then the balloon disappears into the night. After the launch, most students go home, but a few stay to watch the shooting stars. They lie on blankets and look at the clear sky. I see a boy get into a sleeping bag and fall asleep. ‘We’re the only ones talking,’ says one girl quietly. ‘I know,’ whispers another. A meteor crosses the sky. As the balloon rises, it gets bigger until it pops. A parachute helps the lunch box come back to Earth safely. The students will find it the next day using the GPS. Finding it is not easy, but it is fun. The lunch box usually lands far from people. ‘Finding the lunch box is a big part of the fun,’ says the group’s leader. They have lost only two lunch boxes in 53 launches. ‘We learn about the land this way,’ he says. This time, the lunch box landed 84 km from Bishop. The team had to drive around the mountains to get it. They had to decide if driving or walking was better. It could be hard if the lunch box was on a high mountain or in a tall tree. ‘These students know the Eastern Sierra well,’ their leader says. ‘What seems wild to some is normal to them.’ It took them 11 hours to find the lunch box. It was on a rock in a waterfall. The camera did not record any shooting stars. It was a bit disappointing, but they could talk about why. And it was another adventure to share.'

Chloe Morgan did not like science or Palaeontology when she was young. But when she was fifteen, she helped her brother with a school project about dinosaurs. She read an article about new dinosaur discoveries and found it very interesting. She decided she wanted to learn more about Palaeontology.
Chloe met a famous palaeontologist named Matt Cornelius. She was nervous, but he was friendly and answered her questions. This made her feel comfortable.
Chloe talks about how movies like Jurassic Park make people interested in dinosaurs, but they do not show what palaeontologists really do. In movies, palaeontologists are shown as strange or funny people, but in real life, they do many different things. Chloe digs up dinosaur bones, works in labs, and writes for science magazines. She also likes to talk to people about science, especially young people, to help them understand it better.
Chloe helped with a TV show called Walking with Dinosaurs. She made sure the dinosaurs looked real and were from the same time period. The show was popular with people of all ages because it showed dinosaurs in a new way.
Chloe thinks people like dinosaurs because they make us curious and remind us there is still more to learn about the world. Palaeontology is like traveling back in time to discover new things.

When you go on a car trip with your family, you might ask, "Are we there yet?" many times. But you know you are not there yet. When you get there, it is not "there" anymore. It is "here." So, you should ask, "Are we here yet?"
Parents want to be "there" more than kids do. Kids can relax in the back seat. They can watch DVDs, listen to music, and do puzzles. Outside, you can see nice views from the window. In the front seat, mom or dad gives juice and cookies. They change the radio and make sure everything is okay.
Sometimes, my brother Tim bothers me. He puts his foot on my side. I put my foot on his side. Then we fight. Mom or dad stops the fight and tells Tim to stay in his seat. We calm down and look outside again.
Later, Tim blows air on me. He is not touching me, but it makes me mad. Mom or dad tells him to stop. We calm down again.
Dad has a funny way to answer "Are we there yet?" He says, "Yes, we are here. Get out of the car." But we are still on the road. So, we know we are not there yet.
You know you are "there" when mom and dad get out of the car and walk away from the kids. If they are still in the car, the answer is: no, you are not there yet.

John and Zuzi Morgan have a café in Oxford, UK. In their café, people can drink coffee, eat cake, and play board games. John and Zuzi want people to have fun and come back again. Zuzi says they started the café because people use phones and gadgets too much. They want people to talk and play together, not just look at screens.
In their café, people play games called 'Eurogames'. These games have easy themes like farming. One famous game is Catan, where players build on an island and trade with each other. Everyone stays involved, and no one feels left out. Some games are 'co-operative', meaning everyone wins or loses together. One such game is Pandemic, where players solve problems as a team. Matt Leacock, a game designer, made Pandemic. He liked a game called Lord of the Rings and wanted to make a game that made people feel good, win or lose.
Matt loved games since he was a child. He used to feel sad when games were not fun, so he tried to make better games with his uncle. Pandemic became very popular. It tells a story, like a video game, where players change the world and rules as they play.
Video games helped board games become popular. Many people play games on their phones now. Ben Hogg, who works at a games company, says everyone plays games on their phones. Before, people played video games together in the same room. Now, they play online, away from each other. Some people miss playing games with others in person.
John and Zuzi's café shows that board games are more than just fun. In a world where people are often online, games help people connect in real life. This trend will continue.

Jamie Scott is a famous music writer and producer from the UK. His story shows that working hard is important in music. Jamie's mother was a great singer and taught him guitar. He listened to local radio at home, which influenced him. He first heard modern music at age 12. Jamie played tennis very well, but he loved music more. He spent time in the school music room playing piano. At 17, he left school to become a musician. He was in a music duo with a friend, but his friend did not want a music career. Jamie told his parents he wanted to make music. His dad gave him 18 months to succeed or get a job. Jamie got a music deal at 19, but he had to leave his friend. He became famous by writing songs for others, not by performing. Jamie says he is one of the top songwriters in the UK. He helps new artists by writing songs that can be very popular. Jamie wants to write songs that many people will listen to. He is honest about wanting to write hit songs. Jamie believes in writing great pop songs that people will love.

Tony Connor is a new kind of famous person. He is very popular online, but many people do not know him. Tony rides a bike and does tricks. He jumps from high places like roofs and walls. People film his tricks and put them on the internet.
I met Tony at a BMX park on a Saturday morning. Many boys and older people knew him and said he is a "legend." I watched him do tricks and saw he is very brave and creative. Before each trick, Tony tells me what he will do. Sometimes I do not believe he can do it, but he always does. When I say nice things to him, he does not seem very happy. Tony says he does not like being famous. He likes doing tricks more than talking to people.
Tony's fame comes from social media and cameras. He says this technology helps him make money. He thinks many people spend too much time with cameras and screens, but he is not upset. He makes a good living from his videos. 
Tony says to be good at sports, you need energy and to be strong when things go wrong. Even when Tony falls, he gets up and tries again. Some people think Tony takes too many risks, but he says they do not understand his sport. He listens to experts to stay safe.
Tony is careful about risks. He feels scared sometimes but finds a way to do the tricks. He plans a lot and makes sure he is ready before trying something new. Tony says if he is brave and focused, he can do the tricks well.

Helen Skelton is a TV presenter. She does hard things for charity. She ran in a desert and went down the Amazon river in a small boat. Her new challenge was walking on a high wire. The wire was 66 meters above the ground. It was between two towers of an old power station. She had no safety net. She wore a belt attached to another wire above her. She carried a long stick to help her balance. The stick was heavy, eight kilograms. Helen learned from an expert. She found high-wire walking very hard. She trained every day. She ran up a hill and did exercises. She learned how to fall on the wire safely. Falling hurt, but she stayed positive. On the challenge day, it was windy. Helen took deep breaths and walked slowly. The walk was 150 meters and took 15 minutes. Helen said it was very scary. She was happy when it was over. Helen wants to do more charity work. She plans to go to the South Pole using skis, a kite, and a bike.

In 2006, Jeff Somers started a trip around the world on a penny farthing. A penny farthing is an old bicycle with one big wheel and one small wheel. Jeff liked motor sports and worked with racing car engines. He saved money by riding an old bicycle to work. He also rode it to Amsterdam for a holiday. This trip made him want to see the world by bike. Jeff did not want a normal bike. He wanted to make his own bike. He thought a penny farthing was the craziest bike, so he went to a museum to learn how to make one. He tried to start his trip in 2001 and 2003, but he had to stop because of a knee injury. Finally, in 2006, he started his trip. He traveled for three years and visited 23 countries on four continents. The best part of his trip was seeing Mount Everest in Tibet. He met other cyclists who could ride up mountains, but he was happy with his penny farthing. People were amazed by his bike. The worst part of his trip was when he drank dirty water and got very sick. He was in bed for ten days without medicine. He had no money for a hospital or to go home. Even with these problems, Jeff says he would travel again on his penny farthing if he had the money.

I work at a university in the US. My team and I study water birds. We are learning about a bird called the American black duck. We use a special tool called a 'night-vision scope'. This tool helps us see ducks at night. We are worried because there are not many black ducks now. We do not know if they have enough food on the east coast. We know what they do in the day, but not at night. The new tool helps us see them clearly at night. We can learn more and help them better. 
Our work is hard. There are four people on my team. Each person works six hours every day. We study ducks in different places. I take a boat to some places and write notes about the ducks I see. The weather is not always good. Some nights are nice, but many nights are wet. It is very quiet, so I drink a lot of coffee to stay awake! We only missed one day of work because of deep snow. I like this work, even though it is hard. In the summer, we will work inside a lab. We will look at our results. It will be hard to stay inside, but it is important. I love my work and would not change it!

'When I tell people about my job, they are surprised. But it's true! I work with chocolate every day. I taste chocolate to make sure it is good for our customers. Every week, I get small pieces of chocolate from our factory. I check how they taste, feel, and smell. I also taste things we put in the chocolate, like nuts and fruit. I choose the best ones. Next to my office, I have a kitchen. I make and taste chocolate there. I give some to my work friends too! My kitchen has many machines and ingredients. It is nice to have my own space. My job is different every day. Sometimes I am in the food lab. Other times, I travel to buy ingredients. I have a young family, so traveling can be hard. But I like the change and the chocolate! People often ask if I get tired of chocolate. I have worked with it for a long time, but I still love to eat it. I even eat more chocolate at home in the evening!'

'Have you ever thought about what it’s like to be in a circus? Sophia Grayson works at Circus Experience. It is a place where young people learn circus skills. Her course is popular because it teaches many things. You can learn to juggle, throw and catch balls, and even do tricks with fire. You can also learn trapeze, which is flying in the air. Students take a year-long course. They slowly learn to do more difficult tricks. Sometimes, parents come to watch. Sophia says circus performers need to do new things all the time. They must keep their shows exciting. To be good in the circus, you must practice a lot. You also make friends and learn from them. Being strong is important. Circus artists train every day like athletes. The best performers want to be successful, have new ideas, and always get better. Some people think you might get hurt or work only a little each year. But really, you need to think about the future. You can only travel with the circus when you are young. Later, you need other plans. The course also teaches business skills. Many students start businesses in different countries. They like to share their stories. Sophia says you don’t make a lot of money in the circus. The job does not have a regular salary. It is also competitive, but it is a lot of fun!'
